title: Hydrogen Is One Answer to Climate Change. Getting It Is the Hard Part.
summary: Hydrogen is one of the most plentiful elements in the universe, but producing it in a way that is emission-free is costly. Pioneering companies are working to change that.

title: How Europe’s Ambitious New Climate Agenda Will Affect Businesses
summary: The far-reaching plan to reduce the trade bloc’s carbon footprint includes tougher mandates for automakers, steel makers, airlines, energy producers and other industries.

title: Here’s what happened in markets today.
summary: The pace was the fastest since August 2018, and the British pound and government bond yields rose in response.

title: China’s Growth Slows as Pandemic Fears Persist
summary: Growth in the world’s second-largest economy lost steam as more expensive raw materials weighed on factories, though retail sales showed signs of stabilizing.

title: Inflation? Not in Japan. And That Could Hold a Warning for the U.S.
summary: If the United States’ bout of rising prices soon eases, its economy could fall back into the cycle of weak inflation that preceded the pandemic — a situation much like Japan’s.

title: Building Solar Farms May Not Build the Middle Class
summary: Some of the wealthiest companies in the world are investing in the green economy. But they’re not investing in paying union wages.

title: OPEC Plus Agrees on Oil Production Increase, Easing Pressure on Supplies and Prices
summary: The pact clears the way for the group to pump more oil as global economies revive from pandemic lockdowns.

title: Virus Headwinds Hit Wall St. After Months of Smooth Sailing
summary: The S&P 500 fell as much as 2 percent, a reflection of concerns about economic growth and new restrictions on travel and tourism.

title: Stocks rebound a day after a rout prompted by fears over the Delta variant.
summary: The S&P 500 rose 1.5 percent on Tuesday. On Monday it had fallen 1.6 percent in its sharpest decline since mid-May.

title: The Fed’s Favorite Price Index Rose 4 Percent. What Comes Next?
summary: The Federal Reserve’s inflation gauge popped in June from a year earlier. Economists think it will begin to moderate.

title: Here’s what happened in markets today.
Robinhood’s shares jump as much as 65 percent, like the meme stocks it enabled.
summary: Robinhood became a publicly traded company only last week. Its stock stumbled in its first day of trading on Thursday, finishing down more than 8 percent.

title: Going for Broke in Cryptoland
summary: Some hype coins mint instant millionaires. Others go bust. Why not take a chance?

title: Here’s what happened in the markets today.
summary: Stocks rose in early trading, and the Labor Department said  jobless claims declined slightly last week.

title: Evergrande Went From China’s Biggest Developer to One of Its Worst Debtors
summary: Regulators want to fix the property sector’s bad habit of borrowing too much. Evergrande, with its billions of dollars in debt, may stand in the way.

title: Selling Fruit Where the Taliban Stalk the Streets
summary: For weeks, the northern city of Kunduz has suffered daily street battles. Times journalists were there to document a cat-and-mouse war for control.

title: Europe Unveils Plan to Shift From Fossil Fuels, Setting Up Potential Trade Spats
summary: The proposal would impose tariffs on some imports from countries with looser environmental rules. It would also mean the end of sales in the European Union of new gas- and diesel-powered cars in just 14 years.

title: ‘I Am Thirsty!’ Water Shortages Compound Iran’s Problems
summary: A prolonged drought worsened by climate change and government mismanagement has added a volatile new element to the swirl of challenges in Iran, ranging from the pandemic to U.S. sanctions.

title: Russia Signs Deal With Dubai Logistics Company to Navigate Thawing Arctic
summary: DP World, a leading logistics company, agreed on Friday to cooperate with a Russian state company on shipping ventures in the Arctic Ocean.

title: U.S. to Announce Troop Drawdown From Iraq, but Little Is Expected to Change
summary: The deal appears to be the latest effort by the Iraqi prime minister to balance the needs and demands of the country’s two closest allies: the United States and Iran.

title: Russia Doesn’t Send U.S. Investor to Jail but Still Sends a Warning
summary: Michael Calvey had long championed investing in Russia. His conviction on embezzlement charges alarmed business leaders, even if his sentence spared him prison.
